title: When I used the Window system to train the code, the code reported an errorï¼š'>' not supported between instances of 'NoneType' and 'int'
body:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "D:/SiamMask/tools/train_siammask.py", line 296, in <module>
    main()
  File "D:/SiamMask/tools/train_siammask.py", line 170, in main
    train(train_loader, dist_model, optimizer, lr_scheduler, args.start_epoch, cfg)
  File "D:/SiamMask/tools/train_siammask.py", line 188, in train
    for iter, input in enumerate(train_loader):
  File "D:\Anaconda\envs\mask\lib\site-packages\torch\utils\data\dataloader.py", line 314, in __next__
    batch = self.collate_fn([self.dataset[i] for i in indices])
  File "D:\Anaconda\envs\mask\lib\site-packages\torch\utils\data\dataloader.py", line 314, in <listcomp>
    batch = self.collate_fn([self.dataset[i] for i in indices])
  File "D:\SiamMask\datasets\siam_mask_dataset.py", line 551, in __getitem__
    search_mask = (cv2.imread(search[2], 0) > 0).astype(np.float32)
TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'NoneType' and 'int'
